title: Somali 101:Language and Culture Roadmap
text:
This document serves as a comprehensive guide for learners of the Somali language, designed to support both self-study and community-based instruction.
It is a central hub for:

Structured study notes organized by theme

Essential vocabulary relevant to everyday life

Practice exercises for speaking, listening, reading, and writing

Cultural and generational engagement, including Somali proverbs and dialogues

Progress tracking for students over the course of their learning

The course is intended for learners at all levels and is structured as a series of thematic units that build gradually toward fluency. It is especially suited for summer intensives or weekend community classes.






Why Somali Matters




Af Soomaali la’aanta waa aqoon la’aan.
To be without Somali is to be without knowledge.

title: Somali 101:Language and Culture Roadmap
section: 2.1 Kalmado Muhiim ah iyo Weedho – Key Vocabulary and Phrases
text:
2.1 Kalmado Muhiim ah iyo Weedho – Key Vocabulary and Phrases



English
Somali




Peace be upon you
Asalaamu Calaykum


And peace be upon you
Wa Calaykum Salaam


Good morning
Subax wanaagsan


How are you?
Sidee tahay / See tahay / Ii waran?


I am fine
Waan fiicanahay


Welcome
Soo dhowoow


What is your name?
Magacaa?


My name is …
Magacaygu waa …


Where are you from?
Xagee baad ka timid?


I am from Somalia
Waxaan ka imid Soomaaliya


Nice to meet you
Kulan wanaagsan


Goodbye
Nabadeey / Macsalaamo


Teacher
Macallin


Student
Arday


Phone
Telefoon


Address
Adrees / Cinwaan

section: 2.2 Magacyada iyo Erayada Shaqada – Professions and Work-Related Terms

Carpenter

Hawlgab


Translator

Accountant
Xisaabiye


Unemployed

title: Somali 101:Language and Culture Roadmap
section: 2.3 Isku Day: Tarjum Weedhahan – Try Translating These Sentences
text:
2.3 Isku Day: Tarjum Weedhahan – Try Translating These Sentences

Magacaygu waa … waxaan ka imid …
Magacaa? (Wiil/Gabar)
Waxaan ahay Soomaali.
Waxaan ka imid Mareykanka.
Xaggee baad ka timid?
Waa maxay shaqadaada?
Waxaan ahay macallin.
Waan fiicanahay, mahadsanid.
Subax wanaagsan!
Nabadeey! Waa inoo mar kale haddii u ilaahey idmo!

title: Somali 101:Language and Culture Roadmap
section: 2.6 Sheeko Dheer oo Isbarasho – Extended Introductory Dialogue
text:
2.6 Sheeko Dheer oo Isbarasho – Extended Introductory Dialogue
Qof 1: Iska warran!
Qof 2: Waan fiicanahay. Soo dhowoow!
Qof 1: Sidee tahay?
Qof 2: Waan fiicanahay, Alxamdulillaah. Adiguna?
Qof 1: Magacaa?
Qof 2: Magacaygu waa Axmed. Adiga?
Qof 1: Waxaan ahay Saara. Xaggee baad ka timid?
Qof 2: Waxaan ka imid Muqdisho. Adiguna?
Qof 1: Waxaan ka imid Nairobi. Shaqadaada?
Qof 2: Waxaan ahay macallin. Adiguna?
Qof 1: Waxaan ahay ardayad. Cinwaankaagu?
Qof 2: Waa 12 Jidka Muqdisho. Kaaga na?
Qof 1: Waa 8 Waddada Wajeer. Nambarkaaga telefoonka?
Qof 2: 061-2345678. Kanaga?
Qof 1: 061-8765432. Emailkaagu?
Qof 2: ahmed@gmail.com. Kaaga na?
Qof 1: sarah@email.com.
Qof 2: Aad baan ugu faraxsanahay inaan ku kulmo!
Qof 1: Aniguna sidoo kale!

title: Somali 101:Language and Culture Roadmap
text:
2.7 Maahmaah Soomaaliyeed – Somali Proverb

“Af Soomaali la’aani waa aqoon la’aan.”
“To be without Somali is to be without knowledge.”

title: Somali 101:Language and Culture Roadmap
text:
2.8 Fiiro Gaar ah – Special Note
Baabkani wuxuu xoogga saarayaa fahamka isbarasho, isticmaalkii erayada aasaasiga ah, iyo kalmadaha shakhsiyeed. Soo koobidda weedho iyo ficilada maalinlaha ah waxay gacan ka geysanayaan xoojinta xirfadaha luqadda.
This chapter focuses on understanding introductions, using basic vocabulary, and personal terms. Summarizing daily expressions and actions helps reinforce language skills.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

title: Post With Code

title: Somali 101
text:
© 2025 Liban Hussein
Somali 101 is a grassroots language learning initiative designed to help learners of all ages reconnect with the Somali language in a structured, supportive, and culturally rooted way.
Whether you’re a heritage speaker looking to regain fluency, a complete beginner, or part of the older generation hoping to pass on your knowledge, this project is for you.
The curriculum emphasizes real-world communication, intergenerational learning, and accessible resources. All materials are offered openly to empower communities to teach and learn together.





📚 Vocabulary Lists organized by theme and chapter

🗣️ Dialogues and Conversation Practice rooted in everyday situations

🧠 Grammar Explanations with simple examples

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Activities for All Ages, including ways for elders to share knowledge

🌍 Cultural Notes and Somali Proverbs to deepen language learning








Why Somali Matters




“Af Soomaali la’aani waa aqoon la’aan.”
To be without Somali is to be without knowledge.

Language is not just a tool—it’s a vessel for memory, culture, and connection.
By learning Somali, you are reclaiming a vital piece of who you are—and helping others do the same.
